choices.text: When two branches modify the same lines in a file differently
When you try to merge too quickly
When Git runs out of memory
When the internet connection is lost

question: What do the conflict markers `<<<<<<<`, `=======`, and `>>>>>>>` represent?

choices.text: Error messages that need to be fixed by reinstalling Git
Separators showing your changes vs. incoming changes

question: After resolving conflicts, what commands do you run to complete the merge?
You can abort a merge if you want to start over.
What is a good practice to minimize merge conflicts?

choices.text: Pull changes frequently and communicate with your team
Delete all branches after each commit
